passage_text: Medical Terminology. Medical terminology is the language of healthcare. A solid understanding of this language is important for health care professionals and patients alike. Healthcare providers use medical terminology to describe body parts, diseases, procedures, equipment, and more.

2.10: Human Anatomy and Medical Terminology. In our previous courses, you may have noticed a number of complex anatomy and physiology terms getting tossed around.

Medical Terminology Course and Class Overviews. Medical terminology courses introduce students to the vocabulary used by medical professionals, such as doctors, nurses and medical technologists. This article summarizes the most common medical terminology courses and classes.

Make flash cards. Alexandre Dulaunoy / Flickr / CC BY-SA. Medical terminology is usually taught by body system, so for each system make flash cards that can help you study. Write the medical term on the front of the card and its definition on the back.

Basics. Before we can start in with some new and interesting medical terms, you need to learn a few fundamentals of how medical terminology is constructed as a language.

Program Overview. Improve your medical terminology with the Penn Foster Career School Online Medical Terminology Certificate Program. Common medical terminology is a critical part of the language used by health-care practitioners.

Medical Dictionary, Medical Terminology. Search for medical terms using our medical dictionary. Our dictionary contains definitions and explanations of thousands of medical terms and also features pronunciations and abbreviations.
